turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Keep the change.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: Don't think I won't.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: Meet Irene.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: Irene is going to help.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: You said there was only one person you knew wasn't in on this thing.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: You're going to go see her.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: What!?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: What am I supposed to say to her?

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: It'll come to you. See if you can stop this thing 'fore it gets started. Save us all considerable embarrassment.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: Well?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: What are you going to do now?

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: What are you going to do!?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: This is about power and you haven't got any. There's nothing more you can do. I'm sorry. Thanks for trying.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Thanks for the shine.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: Thanks for the tip.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: Just giving you the gift of a clean windshield. Only cost you a dollar.

turns.speaker: MS. JONES
turns.text: I don't want my windshield cleaned.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: You just think you don't want your windshield cleaned.

turns.speaker: MS. JONES
turns.text: No, I know I don't want it cleaned. Get out of here.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: Don't be like that. Think of me as the Moses of dirty windshields leading you through the desert of dead bugs.

turns.speaker: MS. JONES
turns.text: For the last time, I don't want it cleaned. Now get the hell out of here!

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: It's already done. I've already done it. You have to pay me now.

turns.speaker: MS. JONES
turns.text: I don't have to pay you nothin'.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: You're going to deny me a lousy dollar after I've sweated like a pig giving you the gift of a clean windsheild?

turns.speaker: MS. JONES
turns.text: Fuckin' A.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: I don't think so.

turns.speaker: MS. JONES
turns.text: Hey!

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: I think this is worth a dollar.

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: Oh, we'll have to do better than that.

turns.speaker: MS. JONES
turns.text: You worthless piece of shit! Gimme that!

turns.speaker: MS. JONES
turns.text: Goddamnit, you fuckin' bum, come here!

turns.speaker: HUEY
turns.text: Gimme a dollar.

turns.speaker: MS. JONES
turns.text: Fuck you!

turns.speaker: KRISTA
turns.text: He brought a gun onto the pool deck.

turns.speaker: MYSTERY MAN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: KRISTA
turns.text: He got onto the pool deck with a gun. How did he get past her Security carrying a

turns.speaker: MYSTERY MAN
turns.text: I see. Where is this gun?

turns.speaker: MYSTERY MAN
turns.text: Well, is it real? Do we know anything about it?

turns.speaker: KRISTA
turns.text: It looks real. I don't know anything about guns.

turns.speaker: MYSTERY MAN
turns.text: Could I see it?

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: You stole that.

turns.speaker: MS. JONES
turns.text: No, I didn't. I confiscated it. There's a difference.

turns.speaker: MS. JONES
turns.text: Hey, would you look at this crazy car? Everybody has their own radio. What do you think of that?

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: Everybody does?

turns.speaker: MS. JONES
turns.text: Yep. And you can listen to it without anybody else listening. Let's try it out.

turns.speaker: MS. JONES
turns.text: This is what they call the jack. Hi, Jack!

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: Laughs.

turns.speaker: MS. JONES
turns.text: It goes in that little hole.

turns.speaker: MS. JONES
turns.text: He's going to help the police. Your daddy is going to be a hero.

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: My daddy is going to be a hero? Like Power Rangers?

turns.speaker: MS. JONES
turns.text: That's pretty good.

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: I've done much better ones than this.

turns.speaker: MS. JONES
turns.text: You have, huh?

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: Oh, yes. I'll show you. I have much more colors at home.

turns.speaker: MS. JONES
turns.text: That's good.  That's good, sweetie pie.

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: Where are we going?

turns.speaker: MS. JONES
turns.text: Not very far, honey-pie. Not far at all.

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: I'm not a baby.

turns.speaker: MS. JONES
turns.text: You're a big girl, huh?

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: I'm not a big girl but I'm not a baby.

turns.speaker: MS. JONES
turns.text: Close your eyes.

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: MS. JONES
turns.text: I've got something for you.

turns.speaker: LYNN
turns.text: A surprise?

turns.speaker: MS. JONES
turns.text: You ask too many questions. You want the surprise or not?

turns.speaker: OFFICER TRUST
turns.text: You got this under control?

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: OFFICER TRUST
turns.text: It doesn't look like it.

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: It's under control.

turns.speaker: OFFICER TRUST
turns.text: It better be.

turns.speaker: OFFICER TRUST
turns.text: Somebody mind telling me... ) What the hell happened!?

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: Help me get her off the rug.

turns.speaker: OFFICER TRUST
turns.text: Where is he? Did you lose him?

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: Shut up.

turns.speaker: OFFICER TRUST
turns.text: Get moving.

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: You' oughta learn to relax. I told you I've got it under control.

turns.speaker: OFFICER TRUST
turns.text: It's time. It's time now.

turns.speaker: MS. JONES
turns.text: That one.

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: Nah.  Hates his wife.

turns.speaker: MS. JONES
turns.text: Skate-boarders I don't mind, even though they dress like fuckin' idiots, but when I see some pin-head on rollerblades, I get the definite urge to grease the grill of my car with 'em.

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: Keep your eyes peeled.

turns.speaker: MS. JONES
turns.text: What about them?

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: I'm looking for them.

turns.speaker: MS. JONES
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: Right there.

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: Look at 'em. He'd do anything for her.-

turns.speaker: MS. JONES
turns.text: Young love.

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: Foreigners! Fuck!

turns.speaker: MS. JONES
turns.text: Frogs. They copy our blue jeans and when we need their help in Kuwait, where the fuck are they?

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: You don't want to cause a ruckus, with the little girl and all.

turns.speaker: MS. JONES
turns.text: Come with me, honey.

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: And what happens if I don't call you?

turns.speaker: MS. JONES
turns.text: I kill her anyway.

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: God can't help her, Mr. Watson. Only you can help her.

turns.speaker: MS. JONES
turns.text: Only you.

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: You're wasting time.

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: You talk to a cop, you even look at a cop too long and your daughter is dead.  Do it.

turns.speaker: MS. JONES
turns.text: Go ahead, sugar Die.

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: That's enough.

turns.speaker: MS. JONES
turns.text: 'Daddy has to go now.

turns.speaker: MS. JONES
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: Do it!

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: Come Back.

turns.speaker: MS. JONES
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: Put her on.

turns.speaker: MS. JONES
turns.text: What gives?

turns.speaker: MR. SMITH
turns.text: Just put her on.

turns.speaker: GUARD
turns.text: Any trouble?

turns.speaker: BART
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: GUARD
turns.text: He was a cool one, that Harper. Never broke.

turns.speaker: BART
turns.text: He carried on some; kicked.

turns.speaker: GUARD
turns.text: He never told about the money.

turns.speaker: BART
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: GUARD
turns.text: What do you figure he done with it?

turns.speaker: BART
turns.text: He took the secret with him when I dropped him.

turns.speaker: PREACHER
turns.text: Ben, I'm a Man of God.

turns.speaker: BEN HARPER
turns.text: Tryin' to make me talk about it in my sleep!

turns.speaker: PREACHER
turns.text: No, Ben.

turns.speaker: BEN HARPER
turns.text: What'd I say?  What? What? What? What?

turns.speaker: PREACHER
turns.text: You was quotin' Scripture. You said -- you said, "And a little child shall lead them."

turns.speaker: BEN HARPER
turns.text: Hm!

turns.speaker: PREACHER
turns.text: You killed two men, Ben Harper.

turns.speaker: BEN HARPER
turns.text: That's right, Preacher. I robbed that bank because I got tired of seein' children roamin' the woodlands without food, children roamin' the highways in this year of Depression; children sleepin' in old abandoned car bodies on junk-heaps; and I promised myself I'd never see the day when my youngins'd want.

turns.speaker: PREACHER
turns.text: With that ten thousand dollars I could build a Tabernacle that'd make the Wheeling Island Tabernacle look like a chicken-house!

turns.speaker: BEN HARPER
turns.text: Would you have free candy for the kids, Preacher?

turns.speaker: PREACHER
turns.text: Think of it, Ben! With that cursed, bloodied gold!

turns.speaker: BEN HARPER
turns.text: How come you got that stickknife hid in your bed-blankets, Preacher?

turns.speaker: PREACHER
turns.text: I come not with Peace but with a Sword.

turns.speaker: BEN HARPER
turns.text: You, Preacher?

turns.speaker: PREACHER
turns.text: That Sword has served me through many an evil time, Ben Harper.

turns.speaker: BEN HARPER
turns.text: What religion do you profess, Preacher?

turns.speaker: PREACHER
turns.text: The religion the Almighty and me worked out betwixt us.

turns.speaker: BEN HARPER
turns.text: I'll bet.

turns.speaker: PREACHER
turns.text: Salvation is a last-minute business, boy.

turns.speaker: BEN HARPER
turns.text: Keep talkin', Preacher.

turns.speaker: PREACHER
turns.text: If you was to let that money serve the Lord's purposes, He might feel kindly turned towards you.

turns.speaker: BEN HARPER
turns.text: Keep talkin', Preacher.

turns.speaker: BEN HARPER
turns.text: Where's your Mom?

turns.speaker: JOHN HARPER
turns.text: Out shopping -- you're bleeding, Dad --

turns.speaker: BEN HARPER
turns.text: Listen to me John.

turns.speaker: BEN HARPER
turns.text: Here they come.

turns.speaker: JOHN HARPER
turns.text: Dad, you're bleeding...

turns.speaker: BEN HARPER
turns.text: Listen to me son. You got to swear. Swear means promise. First swear you'll take care of little Pearl. Guard her with your life, boy. Then swear you won't never tell where that money's hid. Not even your Mom.

turns.speaker: JOHN HARPER
turns.text: Yes, Dad.

turns.speaker: BEN HARPER
turns.text: You understand?

turns.speaker: JOHN HARPER
turns.text: Not even her?

turns.speaker: BEN HARPER
turns.text: You got common sense. She ain't. When you grow up that money'll be yours. Now swear. "I will guard Pearl with my life..."

turns.speaker: JOHN HARPER
turns.text: I will guard Pearl with my life...

turns.speaker: BEN HARPER
turns.text: ..."and I won't never tell about the money."

turns.speaker: JOHN HARPER
turns.text: And I won't never tell about the money.

turns.speaker: BIRDIE STEPTOE
turns.text: She don't put in at Cresap's Landing no more, but she still blows as she passes. Come on in and have a cup of coffee.

turns.speaker: JOHN HARPER
turns.text: Ain't nobody stole Dad's skiff.

turns.speaker: BIRDIE STEPTOE
turns.text: Ain't nobody goin' to neither, long as Uncle Birdie's around.

turns.speaker: BIRDIE STEPTOE
turns.text: Ain't seen you in a coon's age, Johnny.

turns.speaker: JOHN HARPER
turns.text: I been mindin' Pearl.

turns.speaker: BIRDIE STEPTOE
turns.text: Pshaw now! Ain't it a caution what women'll load onto a feller's back when he ain't lookin'?

turns.speaker: BIRDIE STEPTOE
turns.text: 'Twas down at Cresap's Landing, Along the River Shore, Birdie Steptoe was a Pilot in the good old days of yore. Now he sets in his old wharf-boat...

turns.speaker: JOHN HARPER
turns.text: When'll Dad's skiff be ready?

turns.speaker: BIRDIE STEPTOE
turns.text: Can't hear ye, boy.  ...So the big boats heave a sigh, They blow for Uncle Birdie...

turns.speaker: JOHN HARPER
turns.text: When'll the skiff be ready?

turns.speaker: BIRDIE STEPTOE
turns.text: And the times that are gone by. I'll have her ready inside of a week; and then we'll go fishin'. How's your Maw?

turns.speaker: JOHN HARPER
turns.text: O, she's all right.

turns.speaker: BIRDIE STEPTOE
turns.text: How's your sister Pearl?

turns.speaker: JOHN HARPER
turns.text: Just fine.

turns.speaker: BIRDIE STEPTOE
turns.text: Leavin', boy?

turns.speaker: JOHN HARPER
turns.text: Yep; gotta watch out for Pearl, Uncle Birdie.

turns.speaker: BIRDIE STEPTOE
turns.text: Well goodnight, boy. Come again -- any time.

turns.speaker: JOHN HARPER
turns.text: Here's your can o' hooks, Uncle Birdie.

turns.speaker: BIRDIE STEPTOE
turns.text: There hain't nary hook in the land smart enough to hook Mister Gar. What a feller needs is mother-wit -- and a horse-hair.

turns.speaker: JOHN HARPER
turns.text: Won't he bust it, Uncle Birdie?

turns.speaker: BIRDIE STEPTOE
turns.text: Shoot, a horse-hair'll hold a lumpin' whale.

turns.speaker: BIRDIE STEPTOE
turns.text: Do you mind me cussin', boy?

turns.speaker: JOHN HARPER
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: BIRDIE STEPTOE
turns.text: Tell you why I ask -- your step-pa being' a Preacher an' all...

turns.speaker: JOHN HARPER
turns.text: Can we eat him, Uncle Birdie?

turns.speaker: BIRDIE STEPTOE
turns.text: If you got an appetite for bones and bitterness.

turns.speaker: JOHN HARPER
turns.text: Uncle Birdie!

turns.speaker: BIRDIE STEPTOE
turns.text: Don't!

turns.speaker: JOHN HARPER
turns.text: Hide us Uncle Birdie! He's a-comin' with his knife!

turns.speaker: RACHEL COOPER
turns.text: Here's what you owe me.  One, two, three, four, five... where's the other basket? Where's Ruby?

turns.speaker: CLARY
turns.text: She went.

turns.speaker: RACHEL COOPER
turns.text: John: you go fetch Ruby.  Big Ruby's my problem girl. She can't gather eggs without bustin' 'em; but Ruby's got mother hands with a youngin, so what're you to say?

turns.speaker: CLARY
turns.text: I'll light the lamp.

turns.speaker: RACHEL COOPER
turns.text: It's more fun hearin' stories in the dark.

turns.speaker: RACHEL COOPER
turns.text: And when little King Jesus' Ma and Pa heard about that plan, what do you reckon they went and done?

turns.speaker: CLARY
turns.text: They hid in a broom closet!

turns.speaker: RACHEL COOPER
turns.text: Where's Ruby?

turns.speaker: CLARY
turns.text: She went.

turns.speaker: CONGREGATION
turns.text: AAA-MENN!

turns.speaker: WILLA HARPER
turns.text: You have all sinned!

turns.speaker: CONGREGATION
turns.text: Yes! Yes!

turns.speaker: WILLA HARPER
turns.text: But which one of you can say as I can say: I drove a good man to murder because I kept a-houndin' him for clothes and per-fumes and face paint!

turns.speaker: WILLA HARPER
turns.text: And the Lord told that man --

turns.speaker: CONGREGATION
turns.text: Yes! Yes!

turns.speaker: WILLA HARPER
turns.text: The Lord said, Take that money and throw it in the River!

turns.speaker: CONGREGATION
turns.text: Yes! Yes! Hallelujah!

turns.speaker: WILLA HARPER
turns.text: Throw that money in the River! In THE RIVER!

turns.speaker: CONGREGATION
turns.text: IN THE RIIV-ER!

turns.speaker: GROCER
turns.text: See ye got two more peeps to your brood.

turns.speaker: RACHEL COOPER
turns.text: Yeah, and ornerier than the rest.

turns.speaker: GROCER
turns.text: How's your own boy, Miz Cooper?

turns.speaker: RACHEL COOPER
turns.text: Ain't heard from Ralph since last Christmas. Don't matter -- I've got a new crop.  I'm a strong tree with branches for many birds. I'm good for something in this old world and I know it, too! We know that she will rout the Devil.

turns.speaker: GROCER
turns.text: Got a good buy in soap, Miz Cooper.

turns.speaker: RACHEL COOPER
turns.text: Don't need no soap. I'm boilin' down the fat from my hog.

turns.speaker: ICEY SPOON
turns.text: It's a mighty good man would come out of his way to bring a word of cheer to a grieving widow!

turns.speaker: WALT
turns.text: So you ain't with the State no more?

turns.speaker: ICEY SPOON
turns.text: Plan on a longer visit next time.

turns.speaker: WALT
turns.text: You don't hardly get settled till you're frettin' to git home again.

turns.speaker: WALT
turns.text: Icey, I'm worried about Willa.

turns.speaker: ICEY SPOON
turns.text: How do you mean?

turns.speaker: WALT
turns.text: I'm figurin' how I can say it so's you won't get mad.

turns.speaker: ICEY SPOON
turns.text: Say what, Walt Spoon!

turns.speaker: WALT
turns.text: There's somethin' wrong about it, Mother.

turns.speaker: ICEY SPOON
turns.text: About what!

turns.speaker: WALT
turns.text: About Mr. Powell. All of it!

turns.speaker: ICEY SPOON
turns.text: Walt!

turns.speaker: WALT
turns.text: Now, Mother, a body can't help their feelin's.

turns.speaker: ICEY SPOON
turns.text: May the Lord have mercy on you, Walt Spoon!

turns.speaker: WALT
turns.text: Mother, I only --

turns.speaker: WALT
turns.text: What's wrong, Mother?

turns.speaker: ICEY SPOON
turns.text: Sshhh! He's in there.

turns.speaker: WALT
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: ICEY SPOON
turns.text: Mr. Powell!  Willa has run away!

turns.speaker: WALT
turns.text: I'll be switched!...

turns.speaker: WALT
turns.text: Just went?

turns.speaker: ICEY SPOON
turns.text: She took out some time durin' the night, -- in that old Model-T --

turns.speaker: WALT
turns.text: Is he hit pretty bad?

turns.speaker: ICEY SPOON
turns.text: All to pieces!

turns.speaker: WALT
turns.text: There's a little peach brandy -- maybe a sip?

turns.speaker: ICEY SPOON
turns.text: A man of the Cloth?

turns.speaker: WALT
turns.text: What can we do, Mother?

turns.speaker: ICEY SPOON
turns.text: I thought if you went and talked to him -- another man --

turns.speaker: WALT
turns.text: Dear Walt and Icey: I bet you been worried and gave us up for lost. Took the kids down here with me for a visit to my sister Elsie's farm. Thot a little change of scenery would do us all a world of good after so much trubble and heartache. At least the kids will git a plenty of good home cooking. Your devoted Harry Powell

turns.speaker: ICEY SPOON
turns.text: Now ain't you relieved, Walt?

turns.speaker: WALT
turns.text: Sure, but you was worried too, Mother; takin' off with never a word of goodbye. I even got to figurin' them gypsies busted in and done off with all three of 'em.

turns.speaker: ICEY SPOON
turns.text: You and your gypsies! They been gone a week!

turns.speaker: WALT
turns.text: Not before one of 'em knifed a farmer and stole his horse. Never caught the gypsies nor the horse.

turns.speaker: ICEY SPOON
turns.text: Lynch him! Lynch him!

turns.speaker: ICEY SPOON
turns.text: Bluebeard!

turns.speaker: WALT
turns.text: Twenty-five wives!

turns.speaker: ICEY SPOON
turns.text: And he killed every last one of 'em!

turns.speaker: ICEY SPOON
turns.text: Draggin' the name of the Lord through the evil mud of his soul!

turns.speaker: WALT
turns.text: Come on!

turns.speaker: ICEY SPOON
turns.text: He lied!

turns.speaker: WALT
turns.text: Tricked us!

turns.speaker: ICEY SPOON
turns.text: He taken the Lord's name in vain and he trampled on His Holy Book!

turns.speaker: WALT
turns.text: String that Bluebeard up to a pole!

turns.speaker: ICEY SPOON
turns.text: He's Satan hiding behind the Cross!

turns.speaker: ICEY SPOON
turns.text: Willa Harper there is certain plain facts of life that adds up just like two plus two makes four and one of them is this: No woman is good enough to raise growin' youngsters alone! The Lord meant that job for two!

turns.speaker: WILLA HARPER
turns.text: Icey, I don't want a husband.

turns.speaker: ICEY SPOON
turns.text: Fiddlesticks!

turns.speaker: ICEY SPOON
turns.text: That feller's just achin' to settle down with some nice woman and make a home for himself.

turns.speaker: WILLA HARPER
turns.text: It's awful soon after Ben's passing.

turns.speaker: ICEY SPOON
turns.text: If ever I saw a Sign from Heaven!

turns.speaker: WILLA HARPER
turns.text: John don't like him much.

turns.speaker: ICEY SPOON
turns.text: Pearl dotes on him.

turns.speaker: WILLA HARPER
turns.text: The boy worries me. It's silly, but it's like there was something still between him and his Dad.

turns.speaker: ICEY SPOON
turns.text: What he needs is a dose o' salts!

turns.speaker: WILLA HARPER
turns.text: There's something else.

turns.speaker: ICEY SPOON
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: WILLA HARPER
turns.text: The money, Icey.

turns.speaker: ICEY SPOON
turns.text: I declare, you'll let that money haunt you to your grave, Willa Harper!

turns.speaker: WILLA HARPER
turns.text: I would love to be satisfied Harry Powell don't think I've got that money somewhere.

turns.speaker: ICEY SPOON
turns.text: You'll come right out and ask that Man of God!  Mr. Paow-well!  Clear that evil mud out of your soul!

turns.speaker: ICEY SPOON
turns.text: You go set down by the River.

turns.speaker: WILLA HARPER
turns.text: Oh, Icey, I'm a sight!

turns.speaker: ICEY SPOON
turns.text: Get along with you.

turns.speaker: WILLA HARPER
turns.text: That boy's as stubborn and mulish as a sheep!

turns.speaker: ICEY SPOON
turns.text: It's a shame!

turns.speaker: PREACHER
turns.text: I must wend my way down River on the Lord's work.

turns.speaker: ICEY SPOON
turns.text: You ain't leavin' in no hurry if we can help it!

turns.speaker: PREACHER
turns.text: My, that fudge smells yummy!

turns.speaker: ICEY SPOON
turns.text: It's for the pick-nick. And you won't get a smidgen of my fudge unless you stay for the pick-nick!

turns.speaker: ICEY SPOON
turns.text: Amen! Amen!

turns.speaker: PREACHER
turns.text: She lieth in wait as for a prey. And increaseth the transgressors among men.

turns.speaker: PREACHER
turns.text: My dear, dear friends! Whatever would I do without you!

turns.speaker: ICEY SPOON
turns.text: Mister Powell!

turns.speaker: ICEY SPOON
turns.text: What could have possessed that girl!

turns.speaker: PREACHER
turns.text: Satan.

turns.speaker: ICEY SPOON
turns.text: Ah.

turns.speaker: PREACHER
turns.text: I burned it.  I tore it up and burned it -- it stank so strong of hellfire.

turns.speaker: ICEY SPOON
turns.text: Amen.

turns.speaker: PREACHER
turns.text: The pitcher has went to the well once too often, my friends.

turns.speaker: PREACHER
turns.text: Ain't no sense in it, neither. I figured somethin' like this was brewin' when she went to bed last night.

turns.speaker: ICEY SPOON
turns.text: How?

turns.speaker: PREACHER
turns.text: She tarried around the kitchen after I'd gone up, and when I went downstairs to see what was wrong...

turns.speaker: ICEY SPOON
turns.text: What!

turns.speaker: PREACHER
turns.text: She'd found this fruit jar of dandelion wine  that the husband -- Harper -- had hid somewheres in the cellar.  She was drinking.

turns.speaker: PREACHER
turns.text: I tried to save her.

turns.speaker: ICEY SPOON
turns.text: I know you did, Reverend. Oh, I know how you tried!

turns.speaker: PREACHER
turns.text: The devil wins sometimes!

turns.speaker: ICEY SPOON
turns.text: Just look at you! Dust and filth from top to toe!

turns.speaker: ICEY SPOON
turns.text: Want me to take 'em up and wash 'em good?

turns.speaker: PREACHER
turns.text: Thank you, no. Thank you, dear Icey. I'll tend to them. Thank you.

turns.speaker: PEARL HARPER
turns.text: Stand still, Miss Jenny!

turns.speaker: JOHN HARPER
turns.text: There! What's so hard about that!

turns.speaker: PEARL HARPER
turns.text: You, Pearl. You swear too.

turns.speaker: PEARL HARPER
turns.text: Who's them Blue Men yonder?

turns.speaker: JOHN HARPER
turns.text: Blue men.

turns.speaker: PEARL HARPER
turns.text: Hing, hang, hung.

turns.speaker: JOHN HARPER
turns.text: You better not sing that song.

turns.speaker: PEARL HARPER
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: JOHN HARPER
turns.text: 'Cause you're too little.

turns.speaker: PEARL HARPER
turns.text: Tell me a story, John.

turns.speaker: JOHN HARPER
turns.text: Once upon a time there was a rich king...  ...and he had him a son and a daughter and they all lived in a castle over in Africa. Well, one day this King got taken away by bad men and before he got took off he told his son to kill anyone that tried to steal their gold, and before long these bad men come back and --

turns.speaker: PEARL HARPER
turns.text: The Blue Men?

turns.speaker: JOHN HARPER
turns.text: Just a man.  Goodnight Pearl, sleep tight; and don't let the bedbugs bite.

turns.speaker: PEARL HARPER
turns.text: 'Night Miss Jenny; don't let the bedbugs bite.

turns.speaker: PEARL HARPER
turns.text: John...

turns.speaker: JOHN HARPER
turns.text: Sshhh...

turns.speaker: PEARL HARPER
turns.text: Now can I tell?

turns.speaker: JOHN HARPER
turns.text: Hm?

turns.speaker: PEARL HARPER
turns.text: When Mr. Powell's our Daddy then I can tell him about --

turns.speaker: JOHN HARPER
turns.text: You swore, Pearl!

turns.speaker: PEARL HARPER
turns.text: John! Don't!

turns.speaker: JOHN HARPER
turns.text: You promised Dad you wouldn't never tell!
